static final int WHITE_DIFF = WHITE_STARTING_ROW > BLACK_STARTING_ROW ? -1 : 1

section.title: Detailed Description
section.para:
Location - an enum consisting of 64 values representing all 64 squares on the board. used to access squares on the board
an enum is used for performance reasons.

section.title: getLoc()[1/7]
section.para: Gets location corresponding to the locIndex provided (0..63)

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: the location if the provided index is inside the bounds(0...63). null otherwise

static Location ver14.SharedClasses.Game.Location.getLoc (int row, int col, boolean flip)[static]

section.title: getLoc()[4/7]

para.computeroutput: static Location ver14.SharedClasses.Game.Location.getLoc (Location loc, Direction direction)[static]

section.para: Gets the location relative to loc in the direction

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: the location if the calculated index is inside the bounds(0...63). null otherwise

section.title: getLoc()[5/7]

para.computeroutput: static Location ver14.SharedClasses.Game.Location.getLoc (Location loc, int add)[static]

section.para: Gets the location that is exactly add squares from loc NOTE: add should be in bitboard format

entry.para: the number of squares to add

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: the location if the calculated index is inside the bounds(0...63). null otherwise

section.title: getLoc()[6/7]

para.computeroutput: static Location ver14.SharedClasses.Game.Location.getLoc (Location loc, int numOfMult, Direction direction)[static]

section.para: Gets the location relative to loc in the direction given and the distance is determined by the numOfMult

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: the location if the calculated index is inside the bounds(0...63). null otherwise

section.title: getLoc()[7/7]
section.para: gets the location corresponding to the provided location string.

entry.para: the square's coordinate according to the Algebraic notation

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: the loc if given str is valid. null otherwise

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: the location if the provided index is inside the bounds(0...63). null otherwise
